Basic details: Robert Smith, a 65-year-old male, presents to the clinic with new onset hoarseness of voice over the past two weeks.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting upright in the examination room, speaking in a raspy voice.
Occasionally clearing his throat.
Demonstrating mild anxiety about his condition.
If the examinee asks about smoking history, respond, “I smoked for 30 years but quit 5 years ago.”
Challenging question: “Could this be something serious like cancer? What should I do next?”
